Imsak: Imsak is the moment to prepare both your body and heart for fasting.
The last part of the night is a precious time for dua.
Fajr: Fajr prayer brings light and barakah to your day.
Starting the day by answering your Lord‚Äôs call fills the heart with peace.
Dhuhr: In the rush of the day, Dhuhr is a calm pause for the heart.
A brief prostration in the middle of the day can ease a heavy mind.
Asr: Asr is a chance to review your day before it ends.
As the sun moves toward setting, let your heart move closer to its Lord.
Maghrib: The iftar table is a blessing; gratitude is its soul.
As the day ends at Maghrib, the doors of dua are wide open.
Isha: Isha is the time to end your day with repentance and trust.
Decorating the night with prayer and dua brings deep tranquility to the heart.

ramadanNotes: Ramadan is a month of disciplining the soul and purifying the heart.
Fasting is more than hunger; it is protecting the tongue, the eyes and the heart.
The nights of Ramadan are precious opportunities to draw closer to Allah.
Every iftar is a reminder of how generously you are provided for.
Ramadan is the month of the Quran; let each day revive you with an ayah.
Charity in Ramadan softens both the giver‚Äôs and the receiver‚Äôs heart.
